message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of automatic synthesis of faces from visual attributes using deep generative convolutional neural networks. The paper proposes a two-stage learning approach where the facial sketch is first synthesized from the input attributes and then the face image is generated based on the synthesized sketch. This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with image synthesis and generation. It also involves the use of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) which are commonly used in computer vision research. The paper also involves machine learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the use of multi-scale generators, which makes it relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the synthesis of faces, which makes it relevant to the Graphics (cs.GR) sub-category.
